title.narrative: Nurek Hydropower Rehabilitation Project Phase I

description.narrative: The project development objectives are to rehabilitate and restore the generating capacity of three power generating units of Nurek hydropower plant, improve their efficiency, and strengthen the safety of the Nurek dam.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Energy and Water Resources, Tajikistan

title.narrative: Generation Capacity of Hydropower constructed or rehabilitated under the Project
Cumulative number of generating units rehabilitated
Estimated increase of winter electricity generation of rehabilitated units due to efficiency improvements
People provided with improved electricity service
Percentage of registered project related grievances (disaggregated by gender) responded to within stipulated service standards for response times
Estimated annual electricity generation of three units included in the scope of the project
Improved dam safety against hydrological and geological risks
Civil, electrical and mechanical works for improvement of the dam safety completed

target.value: Rehabilitation of the spillway tunnel, gates and hoisting system is completed

actual.value: The bidding documents to be finalized in Oct 2021 once geotechnical investigations are completed. The delay is caused by delays inexploratory drilling works on left bank caused by COVID-19.

title.narrative: Upgrade of the dam monitoring instrumentation completed

target.value: The dam monitoring instrumentation is fully operational

title.narrative: Update of EPP and preparation of O&M plans completed

target.value: Final updated EPP and O&M plans are effective and implemented

actual.value: The preparation of Vakhsh Cascade level EPP would commence in August 2021. This intermediate result indicator would be updatedaccordingly during the restructuring after mid-term review in Sep 2021. The O&M and instrumentation plans would be finalized oncethe technical specifications of all supplied equipment are made available to BT. The deadline would be confirmed during Sep 2021mid-term review.
